class_notes:
This course introduces students to the digital humanities as a method to approach art and architectural history. Students will learn techniques and technologies frequently employed in the digital humanities, such as data curation, digital mapping, and 3D modeling, as well as explore existing digital projects to develop a framework for evaluating the purpose and effectiveness of digital humanities tools. At the end of the semester, each student will pick one of the technologies they have learned to create a final shareable project. 
Art History major/minor: makers & materials course
course_description: This course introduces students to digital humanities as a way of approaching art history and architecture. DH methods enable new ways of engaging with historical and cultural materials. Students will learn about these techniques by working with digital tools and exploring existing digital projects.
schedule_location: F 11:30am-1:30pm in Math & Science Center - E301A
